question: A number is increased by 25%, then it becomes 600. The original number is __
A number is decreased by 20%, then it becomes 120. The original number is __
An article costs ₹200. It is sold at a 10% profit. What is the selling price?
A number is decreased by 33 + 1/3 %, then it becomes 180. The original number is __
The price of a shirt was increased by 15% to ₹460. What was its original price?
A student scores 36 out of 60. What is the percentage score?
The population increased from 8000 to 8800. What is the percentage increase?
The total income Yash Sir of 2017, 2018, 2019 is Rs. 364. Every year the salary increases by 20%. What is the income in 2017?
A value increases by 20% and then decreases by 20%. What is the net percentage change?
After spending 40% of his salary, Ravi gave 30% of the remaining to his parents. If he is left with ₹12,600, what is his original salary?
The population of a city increases by 10% annually. If it becomes 1,33,100 in 2 years, what was it 2 years ago?
In a class, 25% of students passed in both Math and English. 42% passed in Math and 58% in English. What percent failed in both?
The price of sugar increases by 25%. By what percent should a household reduce consumption so that the expenditure remains same?
If 45% of A = 30% of B, then what percent of A is B?
The number is increased by x% and then decreased by x%. The final result is 36 less than the original. If x = 20, what is the original number?
The value of an article increases by 10% every year. If its value is ₹48,400 after 2 years, find its original value.
A student secures 30% of total marks and fails by 15 marks. If the passing marks are 40%, what are the maximum marks?
A number is first increased by 10%, then again by 20%, and finally decreased by 25%. What is the net percentage change?
The total income of Eesha in the years 2003, 2004, 2005 was $36,400. Her income increased by 20% each year. What was her income in 2005?

You and your crush wrote the TCS NQT test. While you scored 45% and got 4 marks below the cut-off. Your crush scored 60% and got 8 marks above cut-off and got selected for the interview. What was the maximum marks in the test?
